intro: Octomeron montanum, commonly known as mountain octomeron, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Rubiaceae. It is native to the mountainous regions of South America, particularly in countries like Peru and Bolivia. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. Its leaves are opposite, simple, and often have a slightly hairy texture. Octomeron montanum thrives in high-altitude environments and is adapted to cool, moist conditions.
